page.title: 16Adult Training Centre
page.content: The Adult Training Centre has been open in Sudbury for 11 years.It has 80 mentally handicapped trainees.They learn different subjects which will help them to cope on their own and to get a job. Some of the subjects they do are Art & Craft, Gardening, Cooking, Domestic subjects, light industrial work, social & community work, P.E. For going there every week-day they receive attendance money( max 3 pounds) if they receive any more they do not get any social services allowances. The oldest mentally handicapped trainee is 62 and the youngest is 17. They have 14 staff including MR.F.Read who is the manager, they also have 1 secretary and 1 caretaker. They get money to help them buy new equipment from Social Services and fund raising. BY MATTHEW TWYMAN, RICHARD EDWARDS and CHRISTOPHER HANCOCK.
